Detailed Description

Interface indicating that an object has queriable fields.

This is intended for use in automated processing where the names of the fields that need to be accessed aren't known at compile-time.

WARNING: This class is not intended for "general purpose" use as a super class and should only be extended by instances of VRTObject.

Value* vrt::HasFields::getFieldByName ( const string &  name  )  const

Gets the value of a field, based on the field's name.

This will accept array entries and sub-fields. Examples: 

    getFieldByName("FOO")
    getFieldByName("BAR[2]")
    getFieldByName("FOO.BAZ")
    getFieldByName("BAR[2].BAZ")
    getFieldByName("FOO.BAR[2].BAZ")

When handling sub-entries (e.g. getFieldByName("FOO.BAZ")) the following decision tree is used: 

       +------------------------+  no
       | Is "FOO" a valid name? |----> throw exception
       +------------------------+
                  |yes
                  V
       +------------------------+  yes
       | Is FOO a null value?   |----> return a null value
       +------------------------+
                  |no
                  V
       +------------------------+  no
       | Does FOO implement     |----> throw exception
       | HasFields?             |
       +------------------------+
                  |yes
                  V
       +------------------------+  no
       | Is "BAR" a valid name? |----> throw exception
       +------------------------+
                  |yes
                  V
       +------------------------+  yes
       | Is BAR a null value?   |----> return a null value
       +------------------------+
                  |no
                  V
        return value of FOO.BAR

Note in the above decision tree that the case of "FOO" being null results in a null value being returned which bypasses the checks for the validity of "BAZ". Indexed values (e.g. getFieldByName("BAR[2].BAZ")) are similarly handled with a null value being returned if a higher-up entry is null without checking the validity of the lower entries.

WARNING: The caller is responsible for deleting the memory referenced by the returned pointer.

Parameters:
name The name of the field (see getFieldName).
Returns:
Pointer to the given value (see getField for details). This will never be NULL but may be a pointer a value for which isNullValue() returns true -- this is intentionally done so that code in the following form will be valid: 
    Value *val = x.getFieldByName(name);
    if (!isNull(val)) {
      ...
    }
    delete val;

int32_t vrt::HasFields::getFieldID ( const string &  name  )  const

Gets the ID of the given field.

There is a 1:1 mapping of field ID's and names such that for all n = [0,getFieldCount()), n == getFieldID(getFieldName(n)) is true.

Parameters:
name The field name.
Returns:
The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Exceptions:
VRTException if the field name is invalid.
virtual string vrt::HasFields::getFieldName ( int32_t  id  )  const [inline, virtual]

Gets the name of the given field.

In 90% of cases the field name will be identical to the name used in the applicable get/set function except without the get/set prefix (e.g. "SourceContext" for "getSourceContext"). It is possible to access the names of all fields via the following: 

    for (int32_t id = 0; id < getFieldCount(); id++) {
      // id is the field ID
      getFieldName(id);
    }

In situations where it is desirable to access all available fields, it is faster to use the field ID as this eliminates any string comparisons.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field name.
Exceptions:
VRTException if the field id is invalid.

Reimplemented in vrt::BasicContextPacket, vrt::BasicDataPacket, vrt::BasicVRTPacket, vrt::AbstractGeolocation, vrt::Geolocation, vrt::Ephemeris, vrt::GeoSentences, vrt::ContextAssocLists, vrt::IndexFieldList, vrt::ArrayOfRecords, vrt::SpectrumField, vrt::InetAddress, vrt::PayloadFormat, vrt::Record, vrt::TimeStamp, vrt::UUID, vrt::Point, vrt::EphemerisPacket, vrt::NoDataPacket, vrt::ReferencePointPacket, vrt::StandardContextPacket, vrt::StreamStatePacket, and vrt::TimestampAccuracyPacket.

virtual ValueType vrt::HasFields::getFieldType ( int32_t  id  )  const [inline, virtual]

Gets the type associated with a given field.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field type (n > 0) or -N if the field is a vector of values where N is the component type of the vector.
